intro: Plantago weldenii subsp. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-veined plantain, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features lance-shaped leaves with prominent purple veins, which distinguish it from other plantain species. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense spikes, typical of the Plantaginaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for both ecological and medicinal studies.
